@jurgev is there a way to improve this? I mean, instead of 4 lines of code (the "c" and "d" assignments and the "CHECK" lines) it would be nice to just have a single line "KRATOS_CHECK_CROSS_PRODUCT(b, a);" this is not just a code improvement but it will also simplify this test (test it all once)

@mre-san, I have doubts about the order, as cross product is not an associative vector operation but a product of vectors. I think the result will be different if we swap b and a. @mre-san, do you agree with this?
I think I'm wrong. The cross product is commutative. You can switch a and b and the result will not change.
The only file that has this issue in the PR was a code snippet, so it's okay to do it here.
Checking the z component of the cross product is not enough, since that is not necessarily equal to the length of the vector.
